control

Class GraphController

  • java.lang.Object
    • control.GraphController

  • public class GraphController
extends java.lang.Object
    GraphController controls the graph and the places belonging to the graph, with the help of the PlaceController. Class contains methods to import and export graph and place data.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GraphController()
      Create a GraphController with an empty graph.
      GraphController(DistanceFinder finder, PlaceController placeController, int[][] graph)
      Create a GraphController with a custom DistanceFinder, placeController and graph.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Changes the home address.
      java.lang.String findPlaces(java.lang.String search)
      Finds places that include the given search word in their name or address.

      Returns an array containing the distances from the given node to all other nodes.

      Creates a smaller graph consisting of given amount of nodes, chosen randomly.

      Imports place data from a text file, finds the coordinates for the places and the distances between the places and uses the data to initialize the graph.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphController

        public GraphController()
        Create a GraphController with an empty graph.

      • GraphController

        public GraphController(DistanceFinder finder,
                       PlaceController placeController,
                       int[][] graph)
        Create a GraphController with a custom DistanceFinder, placeController and graph.
        Parameters:
        finder - DistanceFinder object to be used with this GraphController
        placeController - PlaceController object to be used with this GraphControlelr
        graph - The graph in the form of a two-dimensional array. If the graph is not empty it should correspond to the place list of the placeController.

    • Method Detail

      • importPlaces

        public void importPlaces(java.lang.String file)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Imports place data from a text file, finds the coordinates for the places and the distances between the places and uses the data to initialize the graph.
        Parameters:
        file - The name of the file containing place data. Each row in the file must describe the place in the form "Name;Address" (without the quotation marks).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while importing data.

      • useSaved

        public void useSaved(java.lang.String placeFile,
                     java.lang.String graphFile)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Imports a saved graph and saved Place objects from text files.
        Parameters:
        placeFile - The name of the file containing saved Places. Each row in the file must contain a toString representation of a Place object.
        graphFile - The name of the file containing the saved graph. The file must be consistent with the placeFile.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while importing data.

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String placeFile,
                 java.lang.String graphFile)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Saves the current graph into text files. These two text files must be used together next time when importing the saved data.
        Parameters:
        placeFile - The name of the file for places. Note that the file must already exist.
        graphFile - The name of the file for the graph. Note that the file must already exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while saving data.

      • getGraph

        public int[][] getGraph()

      • getDistances

        public int[] getDistances(int index)
        Returns an array containing the distances from the given node to all other nodes.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the wanted node.
        Returns:
        An array where the indexes of the array correspond to the indexes of the nodes and in each index is the distance to the given node.

      • getPlace

        public Place getPlace(int index)
        Returns the place with the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the place
        Returns:
        The Place object with that index, null if there is no such index.

      • getReducedGraph

        public int[][] getReducedGraph(int maximumDistance)
        Creates a reduced graph from the current graph, where each edge that is longer than the given maximum distance, will be removed.
        Parameters:
        maximumDistance - The maximum distance; longer edges will be removed.
        Returns:
        The reduced graph where longer edges have been removed.

      • getSmallerGraph

        public int[][] getSmallerGraph(int maximumNumber)
        Creates a smaller graph consisting of given amount of nodes, chosen randomly.
        Parameters:
        maximumNumber - The maximum amount of nodes.
        Returns:
        The reduced graph in which the rest of the nodes have been removed.

      • getSizeOfCurrentGraph

        public int getSizeOfCurrentGraph()
        Returns the amount of nodes in the current graph.
        Returns:
        The amount of nodes.

      • printPlaces

        public java.lang.String printPlaces(int[] path,
                                    int goal)
                             throws java.lang.Throwable
        Prints the places in the given path.
        Parameters:
        path - An array containing the path.
        goal - The index of the goal node.
        Returns:
        A String describing the path.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if an error occurs.

      • printPlaces

        public java.lang.String printPlaces(int[] route)
        Prints the places in the given route.
        Parameters:
        route - An array containing the route.
        Returns:
        A String describing the route.

      • getHomeAddress

        public java.lang.String getHomeAddress()

      • changeHomeAddress

        public boolean changeHomeAddress(java.lang.String newAddress)
                          throws java.lang.Throwable
        Changes the home address.
        Parameters:
        newAddress - The new home address.
        Returns:
        True if the change was successful, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if an error occurs.

      • addPlace

        public boolean addPlace(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String address)
        Finds the coordinates and distances for the given place and adds it to the current graph.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the place.
        address - The address of the place.
        Returns:
        True if the graph was updated, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if an error occurs.

      • findPlaces

        public java.lang.String findPlaces(java.lang.String search)
        Finds places that include the given search word in their name or address.
        Parameters:
        search - The word to find.
        Returns:
        A String listing all results.
